docs.text: director : penelope spheeris ( decline of western civilization ii - the : metal years , dudes , & suburbia )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: cast : mike myers ( wayne campbell ) , dana carvey ( garth algar ) , : rob lowe ( benjamin oliver ) , tia carrere ( cassandra )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: summary : wayne and garth have a public access show called " wayne's : world . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the show is a underground hit , until benjamin : oliver comes onto the scene .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: benjamin wants to turn the : show into a big hit nationwide , possibly destroying the : essence of " wayne's world " in the process .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: [expectations - medium]
docs.label: positive

docs.text: long review ===========
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i must admit being a bit reluctant going into this film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i didn't believe that they ( mike myers and dana carvey ) could hold it up for an hour and a half , i figured that perhaps the first half-hour would be great , and the rest would be " fluff . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , i was really surprised about how well they were able to keep the laughs going for the virtually the whole film , with the exception of the ending .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( which i won't discuss for obvious reasons , but it's not * that * bad . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: story : the plot was quite thin , but it really wasn't that noticeable , because of the rapid-fire jokes that myers wrote in .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alot of the jokes are very similar to hot shots ! , in being very " parodyish . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( okay , bad term . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: extremely witty throughout , although ( as in hot shots ) it got a bit repetitive in the middle .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: acting : as in many comedies , the acting isn't really * that * important .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , myers turns in a good performance as wayne , playing the character perfectly , ( although i still liked him better back on much music , in a more " canadian " type of mode . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: carvey is okay as garth , but he lacks the spark myers puts into wayne .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tia carrere is mediocre as cassandra , playing it very stilted .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lowe is fine as ben oliver , but is nothing to write home about .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: without a doubt , this movie is mike myers all the way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: direction : spheeris is a classic " music " movie director , making dudes , and decline of western civilization ii -- the metal years .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( she also directed the boys next door , which is different , to say the least . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is very capable , knows how direct a comedy , the correct camera movements it instill laughs , etc . one of the better jobs i can remember for a comedy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: overall : i would suggest to anyone that likes snl's skits to go see this film in the theatres .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , my personal opinion , as in most comedies , is that they work just as well on video .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you definately have to be fan of music , and all forms of media in general to enjoy this film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: without a doubt , this is the best comedy so far this year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it'll make tons 'o' dough for everyone involved .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: let's just hope they make a thousand sequels .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: [sorry , i had to get the lame joke in . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: forgive me . ]
docs.label: positive
